page.title: 03THE CHURCHES SWAFFAM PRIOR 2
page.content: In St Mary's west tower is a font and around the edges of the walls are piles of crumbled bricks. Separating the west tower from the nave is a glass screen. The main nave and north and south aisles are full of oak pews. In the chancel is an alter and to the keft is an original organ. An electric organ now stands in the nave. In the vestry are props and to the left is a doorway leading to the north aisle. The windows are war memorials with sebmarines and planes. Underneath are some brass rubbings. The south aisle has windows of Jesus and brass rubbings beneath. St Cyriacs is empty and the walls are bare. There is a memorial plaque. There are also wooden pillars separating the aisles. At the entrance is a staircase which leads to the balcony.
